intro: Youngia gracilis, commonly known as the slender youngia, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the eastern United States and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Youngia gracilis is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
